{"id": 12, "body": {"name": "Ref/Burrow Finance: To support operation of the pyth oracle", "summary": "The primary approach of this proposal is to provide Oracle to the whole ecosystem of DeFi who needed it, especially aligning with more DeFi platforms coming to near through Chain Abstraction.\\\\n Current DApp that operating with Oracle is Burrow Finance\\\\u{2019}s for the assets price feed, Delta Trade\\\\u{2019}s DCA trader and also Ref Finance trading feature meanwhile in the future there will be more lending protocol like nearlend and omnilane + atlas who might need Oracle ", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Organisation\\\\nRef Finance & Burrow Finance\\\\n\\\\n## Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nAescobar Michael / Aescobar7359 (tg) \\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Whole Team\\\\n15\\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Engineering Team \\\\n8\\\\n\\\\n## Team Location\\\\nChina & South East Asia \\\\n\\\\n## Team background and bios\\\\nTeam is also the main team who run the biggest DEX on NEAR Protocol and biggest money market in NEAR Burrow Finance, also building Satoshi Bridge utilising Chain Signature.\\\\n\\\\n## Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\nSupporting most of the ecosystem partners on NEAR from DeFi, NFT, Gaming etc\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\nRunning the Ref Finance as DEX since 2021 and continuing till now, also building more infrastructure for the NEAR Protocol Ecosystem as a whole and at the same time running Burrow Finance which Oracle is critical to the money market. \\\\n\\\\n## Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\nhttps://app.ref.finance/\\\\nhttps://app.burrow.finance/ \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Non-technical capabilities\\\\nThe Ref team has extensive experience in building a DEX, supported by our marketing and business development strategies, which have generated $7.3 billion in total trade volume since we launched on mainnet.\\\\n\\\\n## In-House Resources\\\\nAll of the team member is InHouse Resources, including designer, project manager, BD and Marketing \\\\nDesigner: @Audrey9215\\\\nBD: @Aescobar7359\\\\n\\\\tPM: @zerochlwork\\\\n\\\\tMarketing: @anmai\\\\n\\\\n## Portfolio of Relevant Work \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/ref-finance \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/burrow\\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/deltatrade \\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n- The primary approach and solution of the proposal\\\\nThe primary approach of this proposal is to provide Oracle to the whole ecosystem of DeFi who needed it, especially aligning with more DeFi platforms coming to near through Chain Abstraction.\\\\n Current DApp that operating with Oracle is Burrow Finance\\\\u{2019}s for the assets price feed, Delta Trade\\\\u{2019}s DCA trader and also Ref Finance trading feature meanwhile in the future there will be more lending protocol like nearlend and omnilane + atlas who might need Oracle \\\\n\\\\n- Why should the committee choose this project?\\\\nThe proposal submitted under ecosystem need and how critical it is to have an Oracle \\\\n\\\\n- Will this solution be open source? What licensing are you releasing under?\\\\nThis Oracle is belong to Pyth Network and will run by Pyth it self \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n- More DApps want to build on top of NEAR when they know there is infra they can utilise without cutting their own cost \\\\n- Easier for the Project owner to develop their plan on NEAR without searching for extra service\\\\n- More assets come to Burrow Finance especially when they know the price feed has been supported through the Oracle \\\\n- Integrate more synthetic BTC assets \\\\n- Integrate more BTC assets that utilise Oracle on Burrow Finance\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Grant Timeline \\\\nGrant will cover September to December Pyth Oracle Fee\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n- Measure success by increasing the influx of assets into the NEAR Protocol, enhancing its options for trading and participation in the lending and borrowing ecosystem.\\\\n- Measurement of this implemented is the accurate price feed for each assets operating under DeFi protocol in NEAR like delta trade DCA also Ref Finance Degen Pool \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n- Burrow Finance will use this as assets price feed \\\\n- Nearlend will use this as assets price feed \\\\n- Ref Finance will utilise Pyth for Degen Pool price feed accuracy to provide fast and accurate swap with good output \\\\n- Delta Trade utilise this for DCA vault \\\\n\\\\n## Budget Total\\\\n4K $NEAR for 4 Months September to December\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\nSeptember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nOctober: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nNovember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nDecember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ref-dev-teller.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "20000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Oracles"]}

{"id": 11, "body": {"name": "Ref/Burrow Finance: To support the operation of the Bridge Aggregator", "summary": "The primary approach of this proposal is to connect more Layer 1 and EVM Layer 2 liquidity to the NEAR Protocol. In just the first week of serving the NEAR Protocol ecosystem, since August 5th, 2024, this strategy has proven effective, with $36K worth of $USDC assets being bridged into NEAR Protocol through the EVM chain. These assets have been actively utilised in on-chain activities such as farming on Ref Finance or being supplied as collateral in Burrow Finance.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Organisation\\\\nRef Finance\\\\n\\\\n## Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nAescobar Michael / Aescobar7359 (tg) \\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Whole Team\\\\n15\\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Engineering Team \\\\n8\\\\n\\\\n## Team Location\\\\nChina & South East Asia \\\\n\\\\n## Team background and bios\\\\nTeam is also the main team who run the biggest DEX on NEAR Protocol and biggest money market in NEAR Burrow Finance, also building Satoshi Bridge utilising Chain Signature.\\\\n\\\\n## Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\nPartnered up with most of the projects in the ecosystem whether they have a token or not. \\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\nRunning the Ref Finance as DEX since 2021 and continuing till now, also building more infrastructure for the NEAR Protocol Ecosystem as a whole \\\\n\\\\n## Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\nhttps://app.ref.finance/\\\\nhttps://app.burrow.finance/ \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Non-technical capabilities\\\\nThe Ref team has extensive experience in building a DEX, supported by our marketing and business development strategies, which have generated $7.3 billion in total trade volume since we launched on mainnet.\\\\n\\\\n## In-House Resources\\\\nAll of the team member is InHouse Resources, including designer, project manager, BD and Marketing \\\\nDesigner: @Audrey9215\\\\nBD: @Aescobar7359\\\\nPM: @zerochlwork\\\\nMarketing: @anmai\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Portfolio of Relevant Work \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/ref-finance \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/burrow\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n- The primary approach and solution of the proposal\\\\nThe primary approach of this proposal is to connect more Layer 1 and EVM Layer 2 liquidity to the NEAR Protocol. In just the first week of serving the NEAR Protocol ecosystem, since August 5th, 2024, this strategy has proven effective, with $36K worth of $USDC assets being bridged into NEAR Protocol through the EVM chain. These assets have been actively utilised in on-chain activities such as farming on Ref Finance or being supplied as collateral in Burrow Finance.\\\\n\\\\n- Why should the committee choose this project?\\\\nSince its mainnet launch, Ref Finance has been dedicated to supporting the NEAR Protocol ecosystem. As the first DEX on NEAR, Ref Finance has been at the forefront of this ecosystem\\\\\\'s growth.\\\\n\\\\n- Will this solution be open source? What licensing are you releasing under?\\\\nSolution and SmartContract will be open source, but we hope NF can cover the audit cost.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n- Bring more liquidity to NEAR Protocol \\\\n- Bring in at least minimum 250K worth of $USDC in the first 1 month\\\\n- More assets option and more token on NEAR with the support of Ref\\\\u{2019}s BD \\\\n\\\\nBe sure to communicate what the finished effort looks like \\\\n- Majority chain connected to NEAR Protocol through this approach \\\\n- More assets been supported to be bridge in and it increase NEAR liquidity in general \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nShould include a timeline with milestones, including what will be delivered for each\\\\n- Aug 20, 2024 Integrated 10 chain supported by Stargate \\\\n- Sep 20, 2024 Integrate MesonFi, which give us more option of assets like USDT, ETH and synthetic BTC \\\\n- 27 Sept 2024 Integrate XLINK to bring more synthetic BTC and connect to more chain like BTC L2 and bring more synthetic btc \\\\n- Oct 11, 2024 Integrate Rainbow to bring FRAX directly from ETH to NEAR Protocol\\\\n- Oct 25, 2024 Integrate Wormhole to bridge in Solana\\\\u{2019}s assets like meme and more \\\\n\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n- Growth of user number in DeFi Ecosystem \\\\n- Liquidity growth on NEAR DeFi Ecosystem\\\\n- 3-5 Million USD worth of assets bridged into NEAR through any other chain\\\\n\\\\nMetrics and measurements that prove your solution was implemented\\\\n- Increase ecosystem on chain trading volume through Ref Finance and Delta Trade which the volume will back contribute to Ref Finance \\\\n- Increase ecosystem liquidity through stable assets \\\\n- More new users who focus on DeFi liquidity use case\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\nWho is currently using your solution? Other ecosystems?\\\\nThe target users of the bridge aggregator are those in the EVM or other ecosystems who are interested in the NEAR Protocol DeFi ecosystem but prefer not to interact with centralised exchanges (CEX). Many users want their liquidity to remain on-chain. With the bridge aggregator, they can easily bridge assets to NEAR Protocol with just one click, using only their NEAR wallet.\\\\n\\\\nCan you share some metrics relevant to your proposal?\\\\nTotal assets bridged over to NEAR through the Bridge Aggregator are handled seamlessly, abstracting the Aurora layer so users don\\\\u{2019}t need to worry about taking additional actions on the Aurora side.\\\\n\\\\nLink to Contract: \\\\nhttps://explorer.mainnet.aurora.dev/address/0x04dFb979Ffa1Fb08B6e6EF626377161CBB085Cf1?tab=token_transfers \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Budget Total \\\\n50K USD worth of $USDC or $NEAR \\\\n\\\\n## Budget Breakdown \\\\n- 10K USD incentive to back end dev focus on integration \\\\n- 10K USD incentive to front end dev to adjust design and build more detail to give better user experience on tracking and developing \\\\n- 10K USD incentive for smart contract Dev\\\\n- 20K USD applied to Marketing and Business Development by incentivizing users who bridge in and do on chain defi activity, especially new wallet \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ref-dev-teller.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "50000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bridges"]}

{"body": {"name": "Kit Wallet Indexer API", "summary": "Kit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of NEAR Lake Framework (which also has an RFP). As Pagoda winds down its services, there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider. ", "description": "## Overview\\\\n\\\\nKit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of [NEAR Lake Framework](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework) (which also has an RFP). As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider. The transition aims to ensure uninterrupted service of this vital data infrastructure, which is essential for various stakeholders in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Current live endpoints**\\\\n\\\\n* Mainnet [https://api.kitwallet.app/](https://api.kitwallet.app/) (currently hosted on AWS)\\\\n* Testnet [https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/](https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/)\\\\n\\\\n## Requirements\\\\n\\\\n**Include the following endpoints on mainnet and testnet:**\\\\n\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/publicKey/:publicKey/accounts\\\\\\', findAccountsByPublicKey);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/staking-deposits/:accountId\\\\\\', findStakingDeposits);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/activity\\\\\\', findAccountActivity);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/callReceivers\\\\\\', findReceivers);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokens\\\\\\', findLikelyTokens);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTs\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTs);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokensFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyTokensFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTsFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTsFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/stakingPools\\\\\\', findStakingPools);\\\\n\\\\n## Usage \\\\n\\\\nThe graph below indicates the most recent usage for the past months KitWallet LB requests: ~350K per day (average response time is less than 0.14 seconds, but there are spikes of 50 seconds or more currently)\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5b10c0a-7aba-4d44-bd33-7a5ae05e42e1 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c4fc10a-8b12-48be-be65-c1b01336b7d5 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n_Note: the majority of endpoint usage, [FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) already supports_\\\\n\\\\nThis Kit Wallet Indexer API is undocumented and not officially supported.  Because of this, many wallets that are more NEAR \\\\u{201c}native\\\\u{201d} have already switched to other solutions like [FastNEAR](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs).  But there are still many [non-custodial](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector) and exchange wallets that depend on the Kit Wallet Indexer service or that we are still confirming their usage. \\\\n\\\\nWe do not have data available which NEAR ecosystem projects are currently using Kit Wallet Indexer but these should include wallets and exchanges and any projects that need to quickly query different token balances.\\\\n\\\\nEcosystem projects that have already  transitioned off of Kit Wallet to better-maintained services include [Nightly](https://nightly.app/), [Meteor Wallet](https://wallet.meteorwallet.app/), MyNEARWallet, NEAR Mobile Wallet, and [Bitte/Mintbase Wallet](wallet.bitte.ai).\\\\n\\\\n#### Monitoring, Alerting, Reporting\\\\n\\\\n* Real-time monitoring of system health and performance with public forward facing status page\\\\n* Alerts for data inconsistencies or indexing delays and public channel & direct communication with major stakeholders using service\\\\n* Internal Dashboard for visualizing system metrics\\\\n* Weekly progress reports during the transition phase to Infrastructure committee asynchronous \\\\n* Quarterly performance and usage reports\\\\n\\\\n#### Documentation\\\\n\\\\n**As part of this transition, maintenance, and proposals, please include;**\\\\n\\\\n* Comprehensive system architecture documentation\\\\n* API documentation including usage examples (mentioning the service will be deprecated and linked to alternative solutions like _[FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) _) \\\\n* User guide for common queries and use cases.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition Steps for selected vendor\\\\n\\\\n1. Review and understand the current Kit Wallet Indexer API infrastructure (including accompanying infra like NEAR Lake) and processes.\\\\n2. Include detailed transition plan,in your milestones\\\\n3. Set up necessary access and permissions for the new team.\\\\n4. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with the current Pagoda team.\\\\n5. Implement and test any necessary changes or improvements to the infrastructure.\\\\n6. Perform thorough testing to ensure data integrity and system performance.\\\\n7. Update all relevant documentation.\\\\n8. Gradually transition operational responsibilities.\\\\n9. Establish new support channels and processes.\\\\n10. Conduct a final review and handover with the Infrastructure Committee.\\\\n11. Conduct official communications on your channels and with the NEAR Developer ecosystems and relevant stakeholders\\\\n12. As part of this RFP and based on current usage, the goal is to provide this as a public good. Part of this transition strategy may include pushing users to alternatives like FastNEAR API. \\\\n13. Estimated transition time, not taking into account any KYC or KYB blockers, is 1 week.  \\\\n\\\\n### Service Level Agreements\\\\n\\\\n1. **Availability**\\\\n    * **Uptime Guarantee**: 99.0% monthly uptime\\\\n    * **Downtime Allowance**: Up to 0.1% of downtime per month\\\\n2. **Performance**:\\\\n    * *This should be tracked internally and shared with Infrastructure Committee (IC)*\\\\n    * **Response Time**:\\\\n        * Better or in line with existing response time.\\\\n    * **Rate Limiting**:\\\\n        * Please outline your rate limiting plan to continue to support Kit Wallet as a public good, if applicable. \\\\n3. **Support**\\\\n* **Support Availability**: Community-based support only (e.g., through forums, GitHub issues, or a developer community Slack/Telegram/Discord channel)\\\\n* **Response Time**: No guaranteed response time, but best-effort responses within 24-48 hours. A single point of contact for urgent issues.\\\\n4. **Data Integrity**\\\\n* **Data Consistency**: \\\\n    * Ensure that there is data validation in place (to show proper information). \\\\n    * Proper backup of data is maintained and the data is up to date. \\\\n5. **Updates and Changes**\\\\n* **Notice for Breaking Changes**: At least 7 days\\\\\\' notice for any breaking changes in the API or infrastructure\\\\n* **Versioning**: Ensure that the new API versions will be backward-compatible wherever possible.\\\\n* Maintenance - Proper updates to the community and stakeholders about any major maintenance which could impact the service, experience and uptime of the API adversely. \\\\n6. **Limitations**\\\\n    * **No SLA Credits**: No financial credits or compensation for outages or performance issues for free public good services. \\\\n    * **Fair Use Policy**: Provide Explicit statements about the intended use for development and the prohibition of production workloads\\\\n7. **Termination Rights**: The right to suspend or terminate the service for users who exceed fair use or misuse the service. IC must be informed about these.\\\\n8. **Failure to Perform:** If Kit Wallet maintenance falls below the performance aforementioned benchmarks, the Infrastructure Committee has the right to transition this public good to another vendor. The current maintainer will be required to facilitate the transition. \\\\n\\\\n### Budget Guidelines\\\\n\\\\n* **Budget**: Proposals should outline a **detailed budget**. A clear breakdown of costs, including development, testing, documentation, maintenance & support, infrastructure, 3rd party services and external API costs. Maintenance cost should be calculated accurately based on provided usage information and existing software costs. Being able to properly assess a budget based on usage is a major factor for qualifying legitimate vendors.\\\\n* **Milestones**: Please highlight the details of the various milestones that are included in your development plan and relevant budgets attached to each milestone. Any metrics around success of the milestone (acceptance criterion) should also be included. Milestone examples include upon signing of agreement, upon official transition, 6 month billing period, 12 month billing period, \\\\u{2026} and so forth. \\\\n* **Contingency**: Include a contingency plan for potential overruns or unexpected expenses. In the event that expense for providing free or a public good to the NEAR ecosystem, there should be a clear policy to report expenses incurred by NEAR usage to cover additional costs and prove that costs exceeded previous budgets. \\\\n\\\\n### Required Experience\\\\n\\\\n* **Experience:** Proven experience in big data processing, cloud infrastructure management, and blockchain data indexing, preferably within the blockchain or fintech sectors. Experience working with NEAR Protocol is a plus.\\\\n* **Portfolio:** Examples of previous work and case studies demonstrating success in similar projects.\\\\n* **Team:** A skilled team comprising developers, data engineers, and support staff with relevant experience.\\\\n* **Relevant Business:** Demonstrate that your team has an existing business that would motivate you to continue building and maintaining this infrastructure\\\\n\\\\n## Resources\\\\n\\\\n**Alternatives to Kit Wallet;**\\\\n\\\\n* Fast NEAR API Server: [https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) (hosted free alternative)\\\\n* Pagoda enhanced api: [https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/](https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/) \\\\n* NEARBlocks api: [https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory](https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory) \\\\n* HERE Wallet ZMQ Indexer [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer)  \\\\n* [Mintbase Indexer](https://docs.mintbase.xyz/dev/mintbase-graph) [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer) \\\\n\\\\n**Support;** \\\\n\\\\n* NEAR Indexer Working Group [https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data) \\\\n\\\\n**Kit Wallet Resources;**\\\\n\\\\n* [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Past Proposals;**\\\\n\\\\n* HERE Wallet [https://gov.near.org/t/proposal-develop-public-near-indexer-from-here-wallet-team-compatible-with-kitwallet-api/37307](https://gov.near.org/t/proposal-develop-public-near-indexer-from-here-wallet-team-compatible-with-kitwallet-api/37307)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Process\\\\n\\\\n**[Proposal Process](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1F7iAT9tWngik9JPS_GadCCEB5nZtA2AiL2yWZoBGMFM/pub)**\\\\n\\\\nYou should submit a proposal in response to this RFP on the Infrastructure Committee Portal.[ Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TVvPXPJhZfaFwfA2UMW6c3pO2kis45SJ1Np1XOkkhnA/edit?usp=sharing) is a standard (+ [markup](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UZRfOE1JAOhsnSmp-RmL2hY7KPJbpBImKZVvPV4YJmA/edit?usp=sharing)) template you can use as a starting point. \\\\n\\\\nMarketing materials, presentations, and images can be attached as needed as external links. An easy way to do this is start a discussion under the RFP category on the Infrastructure Working Group GitHub repository [here](https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/categories/request-for-proposals), publish, then edit and copy the links generated to the files you uploaded.\\\\n\\\\n#### Proposal Submission Dates\\\\n\\\\nThe deadline for proposal submission is **Friday October, 6th** (giving applicants approximately 2 weeks) with Q&A period on the proposal itself. \\\\n\\\\n### Selection Process\\\\n\\\\nAfter reviewing the proposals, the committee will vote on the best one. Generally, this process takes two working weeks to complete and will be discussed and voted on at the regular bi-weekly meeting.\\\\n\\\\n#### Voting Dates\\\\n\\\\nThe estimate for voting completion is **2 weeks** after the proposal submission date.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition Process\\\\n\\\\nEstimated transition time, not taking into account any KYC or KYB blockers, is 1 week.  \\\\n\\\\n### Funding Process\\\\n\\\\nThe Infrastructure Committee governs funding with assistance from the NEAR Foundation. If selected, your proposal enters the funding pipeline. You are required to:\\\\n\\\\n* Complete the KYC/B process conducted by the NEAR Foundation, including verification by IDVerify.\\\\n* Sign a legal agreement regarding the work as outlined in the proposal, conducted by the NEAR Foundation.\\\\n* Submit an invoice to NEAR Foundation Finance outlining how you want funds disbursed, to what wallets or banks, and in the agreed-upon amounts.\\\\n* Complete a test transaction to verify target wallets (when requesting funds in cryptocurrency).\\\\n\\\\n#### Funding Dates\\\\n\\\\nThe funding process is generally completed in one working week if the proposal does not require clarifications in the budget, work approach, legal agreement, or invoicing terms.\\\\n\\\\n## Communication\\\\n\\\\nPlease direct all communications to the thread where the RFP started beneath the submitted proposal. Please direct confidential or sensitive communications to the Telegram group set up between the committee and the organization/entity/team. If you don\\\\\\'t have a private Telegram group between your team and the Infrastructure Committee, please request one in this thread.\\\\n", "rfp_body_version": "V0", "submission_deadline": "1728000000000000000"}, "labels": ["Indexers"]}

{"body": {"name": "Kit Wallet Indexer API", "summary": "Kit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of [NEAR Lake Framework](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework) (which also has an RFP). As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider.", "description": "## Overview\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nKit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of [NEAR Lake Framework](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework) (which also has an RFP). As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider. The transition aims to ensure uninterrupted service of this vital data infrastructure, which is essential for various stakeholders in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Current live endpoints**\\\\n\\\\n* Mainnet [https://api.kitwallet.app/](https://api.kitwallet.app/) (currently hosted on AWS)\\\\n* Testnet [https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/](https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/)\\\\n\\\\n## Requirements\\\\n\\\\n**Include the following endpoints on mainnet and testnet:**\\\\n\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/publicKey/:publicKey/accounts\\\\\\', findAccountsByPublicKey);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/staking-deposits/:accountId\\\\\\', findStakingDeposits);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/activity\\\\\\', findAccountActivity);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/callReceivers\\\\\\', findReceivers);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokens\\\\\\', findLikelyTokens);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTs\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTs);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokensFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyTokensFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTsFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTsFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/stakingPools\\\\\\', findStakingPools);\\\\n\\\\n## Usage \\\\n\\\\nThe graph below indicates the most recent usage for the past months KitWallet LB requests: ~350K per day (average response time is less than 0.14 seconds, but there are spikes of 50 seconds or more currently)\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5b10c0a-7aba-4d44-bd33-7a5ae05e42e1 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c4fc10a-8b12-48be-be65-c1b01336b7d5 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n_Note: the majority of endpoint usage, [FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) already supports_\\\\n\\\\nThis Kit Wallet Indexer API is undocumented and not officially supported.  Because of this, many wallets that are more NEAR \\\\u{201c}native\\\\u{201d} have already switched to other solutions like [FastNEAR](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs).  But there are still many [non-custodial](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector) and exchange wallets that depend on the Kit Wallet Indexer service or that we are still confirming their usage. \\\\n\\\\nWe do not have data available which NEAR ecosystem projects are currently using Kit Wallet Indexer but these should include wallets and exchanges and any projects that need to quickly query different token balances.\\\\n\\\\nEcosystem projects that have already  transitioned off of Kit Wallet to better-maintained services include [Nightly](https://nightly.app/), [Meteor Wallet](https://wallet.meteorwallet.app/), MyNEARWallet, NEAR Mobile Wallet, and [Bitte/Mintbase Wallet](wallet.bitte.ai).\\\\n\\\\n#### Monitoring, Alerting, Reporting\\\\n\\\\n* Real-time monitoring of system health and performance with public forward facing status page\\\\n* Alerts for data inconsistencies or indexing delays and public channel & direct communication with major stakeholders using service\\\\n* Internal Dashboard for visualizing system metrics\\\\n* Weekly progress reports during the transition phase to Infrastructure committee asynchronous \\\\n* Quarterly performance and usage reports\\\\n\\\\n#### Documentation\\\\n\\\\n**As part of this transition, maintenance, and proposals, please include;**\\\\n\\\\n* Comprehensive system architecture documentation\\\\n* API documentation including usage examples (mentioning the service will be deprecated and linked to alternative solutions like _[FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) _) \\\\n* User guide for common queries and use cases.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition Steps for selected vendor\\\\n\\\\n1. Review and understand the current Kit Wallet Indexer API infrastructure (including accompanying infra like NEAR Lake) and processes.\\\\n2. Include detailed transition plan,in your milestones\\\\n3. Set up necessary access and permissions for the new team.\\\\n4. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with the current Pagoda team.\\\\n5. Implement and test any necessary changes or improvements to the infrastructure.\\\\n6. Perform thorough testing to ensure data integrity and system performance.\\\\n7. Update all relevant documentation.\\\\n8. Gradually transition operational responsibilities.\\\\n9. Establish new support channels and processes.\\\\n10. Conduct a final review and handover with the Infrastructure Committee.\\\\n11. Conduct official communications on your channels and with the NEAR Developer ecosystems and relevant stakeholders\\\\n12. As part of this RFP and based on current usage, the goal is to provide this as a public good. Part of this transition strategy may include pushing users to alternatives like FastNEAR API. \\\\n13. Estimated transition time, not taking into account any KYC or KYB blockers, is 1 week.  \\\\n\\\\n### Service Level Agreements\\\\n\\\\n1. **Availability**\\\\n    * **Uptime Guarantee**: 99.0% monthly uptime\\\\n    * **Downtime Allowance**: Up to 0.1% of downtime per month\\\\n2. **Performance**:\\\\n    * *This should be tracked internally and shared with Infrastructure Committee (IC)*\\\\n    * **Response Time**:\\\\n        * Better or in line with existing response time.\\\\n    * **Rate Limiting**:\\\\n        * Please outline your rate limiting plan to continue to support Kit Wallet as a public good, if applicable. \\\\n3. **Support**\\\\n* **Support Availability**: Community-based support only (e.g., through forums, GitHub issues, or a developer community Slack/Telegram/Discord channel)\\\\n* **Response Time**: No guaranteed response time, but best-effort responses within 24-48 hours. A single point of contact for urgent issues.\\\\n4. **Data Integrity**\\\\n* **Data Consistency**: \\\\n    * Ensure that there is data validation in place (to show proper information). \\\\n    * Proper backup of data is maintained and the data is up to date. \\\\n5. **Updates and Changes**\\\\n* **Notice for Breaking Changes**: At least 7 days\\\\\\' notice for any breaking changes in the API or infrastructure\\\\n* **Versioning**: Ensure that the new API versions will be backward-compatible wherever possible.\\\\n* Maintenance - Proper updates to the community and stakeholders about any major maintenance which could impact the service, experience and uptime of the API adversely. \\\\n6. **Limitations**\\\\n    * **No SLA Credits**: No financial credits or compensation for outages or performance issues for free public good services. \\\\n    * **Fair Use Policy**: Provide Explicit statements about the intended use for development and the prohibition of production workloads\\\\n7. **Termination Rights**: The right to suspend or terminate the service for users who exceed fair use or misuse the service. IC must be informed about these.\\\\n8. **Failure to Perform:** If Kit Wallet maintenance falls below the performance aforementioned benchmarks, the Infrastructure Committee has the right to transition this public good to another vendor. The current maintainer will be required to facilitate the transition. \\\\n\\\\n### Budget Guidelines\\\\n\\\\n* **Budget**: Proposals should outline a **detailed budget**. A clear breakdown of costs, including development, testing, documentation, maintenance & support, infrastructure, 3rd party services and external API costs. Maintenance cost should be calculated accurately based on provided usage information and existing software costs. Being able to properly assess a budget based on usage is a major factor for qualifying legitimate vendors.\\\\n* **Milestones**: Please highlight the details of the various milestones that are included in your development plan and relevant budgets attached to each milestone. Any metrics around success of the milestone (acceptance criterion) should also be included. Milestone examples include upon signing of agreement, upon official transition, 6 month billing period, 12 month billing period, \\\\u{2026} and so forth. \\\\n* **Contingency**: Include a contingency plan for potential overruns or unexpected expenses. In the event that expense for providing free or a public good to the NEAR ecosystem, there should be a clear policy to report expenses incurred by NEAR usage to cover additional costs and prove that costs exceeded previous budgets. \\\\n\\\\n### Required Experience\\\\n\\\\n* **Experience:** Proven experience in big data processing, cloud infrastructure management, and blockchain data indexing, preferably within the blockchain or fintech sectors. Experience working with NEAR Protocol is a plus.\\\\n* **Portfolio:** Examples of previous work and case studies demonstrating success in similar projects.\\\\n* **Team:** A skilled team comprising developers, data engineers, and support staff with relevant experience.\\\\n* **Relevant Business:** Demonstrate that your team has an existing business that would motivate you to continue building and maintaining this infrastructure\\\\n\\\\n## Resources\\\\n\\\\n**Alternatives to Kit Wallet;**\\\\n\\\\n* Fast NEAR API Server: [https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) (hosted free alternative)\\\\n* Pagoda enhanced api: [https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/](https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/) \\\\n* NEARBlocks api: [https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory](https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory) \\\\n* HERE Wallet ZMQ Indexer [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer)  \\\\n* [Mintbase Indexer](https://docs.mintbase.xyz/dev/mintbase-graph) [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer) \\\\n\\\\n**Support;** \\\\n\\\\n* NEAR Indexer Working Group [https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data) \\\\n\\\\n**Kit Wallet Resources;**\\\\n\\\\n* [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Past Proposals;**\\\\n\\\\n* HERE Wallet As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider.", "description": "## Overview\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nKit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of [NEAR Lake Framework](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework) (which also has an RFP). As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider. The transition aims to ensure uninterrupted service of this vital data infrastructure, which is essential for various stakeholders in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Current live endpoints**\\\\n\\\\n* Mainnet [https://api.kitwallet.app/](https://api.kitwallet.app/) (currently hosted on AWS)\\\\n* Testnet [https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/](https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/)\\\\n\\\\n## Requirements\\\\n\\\\n**Include the following endpoints on mainnet and testnet:**\\\\n\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/publicKey/:publicKey/accounts\\\\\\', findAccountsByPublicKey);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/staking-deposits/:accountId\\\\\\', findStakingDeposits);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/activity\\\\\\', findAccountActivity);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/callReceivers\\\\\\', findReceivers);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokens\\\\\\', findLikelyTokens);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTs\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTs);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokensFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyTokensFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTsFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTsFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/stakingPools\\\\\\', findStakingPools);\\\\n\\\\n## Usage \\\\n\\\\nThe graph below indicates the most recent usage for the past months KitWallet LB requests: ~350K per day (average response time is less than 0.14 seconds, but there are spikes of 50 seconds or more currently)\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5b10c0a-7aba-4d44-bd33-7a5ae05e42e1 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c4fc10a-8b12-48be-be65-c1b01336b7d5 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n_Note: the majority of endpoint usage, [FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) already supports_\\\\n\\\\nThis Kit Wallet Indexer API is undocumented and not officially supported.  Because of this, many wallets that are more NEAR \\\\u{201c}native\\\\u{201d} have already switched to other solutions like [FastNEAR](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs).  But there are still many [non-custodial](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector) and exchange wallets that depend on the Kit Wallet Indexer service or that we are still confirming their usage. \\\\n\\\\nWe do not have data available which NEAR ecosystem projects are currently using Kit Wallet Indexer but these should include wallets and exchanges and any projects that need to quickly query different token balances.\\\\n\\\\nEcosystem projects that have already  transitioned off of Kit Wallet to better-maintained services include [Nightly](https://nightly.app/), [Meteor Wallet](https://wallet.meteorwallet.app/), MyNEARWallet, NEAR Mobile Wallet, and [Bitte/Mintbase Wallet](wallet.bitte.ai).\\\\n\\\\n#### Monitoring, Alerting, Reporting\\\\n\\\\n* Real-time monitoring of system health and performance with public forward facing status page\\\\n* Alerts for data inconsistencies or indexing delays and public channel & direct communication with major stakeholders using service\\\\n* Internal Dashboard for visualizing system metrics\\\\n* Weekly progress reports during the transition phase to Infrastructure committee asynchronous \\\\n* Quarterly performance and usage reports\\\\n\\\\n#### Documentation\\\\n\\\\n**As part of this transition, maintenance, and proposals, please include;**\\\\n\\\\n* Comprehensive system architecture documentation\\\\n* API documentation including usage examples (mentioning the service will be deprecated and linked to alternative solutions like _[FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) _) \\\\n* User guide for common queries and use cases.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition Steps for selected vendor\\\\n\\\\n1. Review and understand the current Kit Wallet Indexer API infrastructure (including accompanying infra like NEAR Lake) and processes.\\\\n2. Include detailed transition plan,in your milestones\\\\n3. Set up necessary access and permissions for the new team.\\\\n4. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with the current Pagoda team.\\\\n5. Implement and test any necessary changes or improvements to the infrastructure.\\\\n6. Perform thorough testing to ensure data integrity and system performance.\\\\n7. Update all relevant documentation.\\\\n8. Gradually transition operational responsibilities.\\\\n9. Establish new support channels and processes.\\\\n10. Conduct a final review and handover with the Infrastructure Committee.\\\\n11. Conduct official communications on your channels and with the NEAR Developer ecosystems and relevant stakeholders\\\\n12. As part of this RFP and based on current usage, the goal is to provide this as a public good. Part of this transition strategy may include pushing users to alternatives like FastNEAR API. \\\\n13. Estimated transition time, not taking into account any KYC or KYB blockers, is 1 week.  \\\\n\\\\n### Service Level Agreements\\\\n\\\\n1. **Availability**\\\\n    * **Uptime Guarantee**: 99.0% monthly uptime\\\\n    * **Downtime Allowance**: Up to 0.1% of downtime per month\\\\n2. **Performance**:\\\\n    * *This should be tracked internally and shared with Infrastructure Committee (IC)*\\\\n    * **Response Time**:\\\\n        * Better or in line with existing response time.\\\\n    * **Rate Limiting**:\\\\n        * Please outline your rate limiting plan to continue to support Kit Wallet as a public good, if applicable. \\\\n3. **Support**\\\\n* **Support Availability**: Community-based support only (e.g., through forums, GitHub issues, or a developer community Slack/Telegram/Discord channel)\\\\n* **Response Time**: No guaranteed response time, but best-effort responses within 24-48 hours. A single point of contact for urgent issues.\\\\n4. **Data Integrity**\\\\n* **Data Consistency**: \\\\n    * Ensure that there is data validation in place (to show proper information). \\\\n    * Proper backup of data is maintained and the data is up to date. \\\\n5. **Updates and Changes**\\\\n* **Notice for Breaking Changes**: At least 7 days\\\\\\' notice for any breaking changes in the API or infrastructure\\\\n* **Versioning**: Ensure that the new API versions will be backward-compatible wherever possible.\\\\n* Maintenance - Proper updates to the community and stakeholders about any major maintenance which could impact the service, experience and uptime of the API adversely. \\\\n6. **Limitations**\\\\n    * **No SLA Credits**: No financial credits or compensation for outages or performance issues for free public good services. \\\\n    * **Fair Use Policy**: Provide Explicit statements about the intended use for development and the prohibition of production workloads\\\\n7. **Termination Rights**: The right to suspend or terminate the service for users who exceed fair use or misuse the service. IC must be informed about these.\\\\n8. **Failure to Perform:** If Kit Wallet maintenance falls below the performance aforementioned benchmarks, the Infrastructure Committee has the right to transition this public good to another vendor. The current maintainer will be required to facilitate the transition. \\\\n\\\\n### Budget Guidelines\\\\n\\\\n* **Budget**: Proposals should outline a **detailed budget**. A clear breakdown of costs, including development, testing, documentation, maintenance & support, infrastructure, 3rd party services and external API costs. Maintenance cost should be calculated accurately based on provided usage information and existing software costs. Being able to properly assess a budget based on usage is a major factor for qualifying legitimate vendors.\\\\n* **Milestones**: Please highlight the details of the various milestones that are included in your development plan and relevant budgets attached to each milestone. Any metrics around success of the milestone (acceptance criterion) should also be included. Milestone examples include upon signing of agreement, upon official transition, 6 month billing period, 12 month billing period, \\\\u{2026} and so forth. \\\\n* **Contingency**: Include a contingency plan for potential overruns or unexpected expenses. In the event that expense for providing free or a public good to the NEAR ecosystem, there should be a clear policy to report expenses incurred by NEAR usage to cover additional costs and prove that costs exceeded previous budgets. \\\\n\\\\n### Required Experience\\\\n\\\\n* **Experience:** Proven experience in big data processing, cloud infrastructure management, and blockchain data indexing, preferably within the blockchain or fintech sectors. Experience working with NEAR Protocol is a plus.\\\\n* **Portfolio:** Examples of previous work and case studies demonstrating success in similar projects.\\\\n* **Team:** A skilled team comprising developers, data engineers, and support staff with relevant experience.\\\\n* **Relevant Business:** Demonstrate that your team has an existing business that would motivate you to continue building and maintaining this infrastructure\\\\n\\\\n## Resources\\\\n\\\\n**Alternatives to Kit Wallet;**\\\\n\\\\n* Fast NEAR API Server: [https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) (hosted free alternative)\\\\n* Pagoda enhanced api: [https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/](https://console.pagoda.co/apis?tab=enhancedApi#/) \\\\n* NEARBlocks api: [https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory](https://api.nearblocks.io/v1/account/rektdegen.near/inventory) \\\\n* HERE Wallet ZMQ Indexer [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer)  \\\\n* [Mintbase Indexer](https://docs.mintbase.xyz/dev/mintbase-graph) [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer) \\\\n\\\\n**Support;** \\\\n\\\\n* NEAR Indexer Working Group [https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data) \\\\n\\\\n**Kit Wallet Resources;**\\\\n\\\\n* [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Past Proposals;**\\\\n\\\\n* HERE Wallet As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider.", "timeline": {"status": "ACCEPTING_SUBMISSIONS"}, "editor_id": "trechriron71.near", "timestamp": "1727108362228800445", "description": "## Overview\\\\n\\\\nKit Wallet Indexer API is an undocumented but widely used lightweight indexer that helps to find user\\\\u{2019}s FTs, NFTs, and accounts by public key, that builds off of [NEAR Lake Framework](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework) (which also has an RFP). As [Pagoda winds down its services](https://docs.near.org/blog/2024-08-13-pagoda-services), there is a need to transition the management and development of the Kit Wallet Indexer to a capable service provider. The transition aims to ensure uninterrupted service of this vital data infrastructure, which is essential for various stakeholders in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/indexer.js)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints Code: [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper/blob/master/src/middleware/indexer.js)\\\\n\\\\n**Current live endpoints**\\\\n\\\\n* Mainnet [https://api.kitwallet.app/](https://api.kitwallet.app/) (currently hosted on AWS)\\\\n* Testnet [https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/](https://testnet-api.kitwallet.app/)\\\\n\\\\n## Requirements\\\\n\\\\n**Include the following endpoints on mainnet and testnet:**\\\\n\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/publicKey/:publicKey/accounts\\\\\\', findAccountsByPublicKey);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/staking-deposits/:accountId\\\\\\', findStakingDeposits);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/activity\\\\\\', findAccountActivity);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/callReceivers\\\\\\', findReceivers);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokens\\\\\\', findLikelyTokens);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTs\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTs);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyTokensFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyTokensFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/account/:accountId/likelyNFTsFromBlock\\\\\\', findLikelyNFTsFromBlock);\\\\n* router.get(\\\\\\'/stakingPools\\\\\\', findStakingPools);\\\\n\\\\n## Usage \\\\n\\\\nThe graph below indicates the most recent usage for the past months KitWallet LB requests: ~350K per day (average response time is less than 0.14 seconds, but there are spikes of 50 seconds or more currently)\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5b10c0a-7aba-4d44-bd33-7a5ae05e42e1 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n![alt_text](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c4fc10a-8b12-48be-be65-c1b01336b7d5 \\\\\\\"image_tooltip\\\\\\\")\\\\n\\\\n_Note: the majority of endpoint usage, [FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) already supports_\\\\n\\\\nThis Kit Wallet Indexer API is undocumented and not officially supported.  Because of this, many wallets that are more NEAR \\\\u{201c}native\\\\u{201d} have already switched to other solutions like [FastNEAR](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs).  But there are still many [non-custodial](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector) and exchange wallets that depend on the Kit Wallet Indexer service or that we are still confirming their usage. \\\\n\\\\nWe do not have data available which NEAR ecosystem projects are currently using Kit Wallet Indexer but these should include wallets and exchanges and any projects that need to quickly query different token balances.\\\\n\\\\nEcosystem projects that have already  transitioned off of Kit Wallet to better-maintained services include [Nightly](https://nightly.app/), [Meteor Wallet](https://wallet.meteorwallet.app/), MyNEARWallet, NEAR Mobile Wallet, and [Bitte/Mintbase Wallet](wallet.bitte.ai).\\\\n\\\\n#### Monitoring, Alerting, Reporting\\\\n\\\\n* \\\\u{200b}\\\\u{200b}Real-time monitoring of system health and performance with public forward facing status page\\\\n* Alerts for data inconsistencies or indexing delays and public channel & direct communication with major stakeholders using service\\\\n* Internal Dashboard for visualizing system metrics\\\\n* Weekly progress reports during the transition phase to Infrastructure committee asynchronous \\\\n* Quarterly performance and usage reports\\\\n\\\\n#### Documentation\\\\n\\\\n**As part of this transition, maintenance, and proposals, please include;**\\\\n\\\\n* Comprehensive system architecture documentation\\\\n* API documentation including usage examples (mentioning the service will be deprecated and linked to alternative solutions like _[FastNear](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) _) \\\\n* User guide for common queries and use cases.\\\\n\\\\n### Transition Steps for selected vendor\\\\n\\\\n1. Review and understand the current Kit Wallet Indexer API infrastructure (including accompanying infra like NEAR Lake) and processes.\\\\n2. Include detailed transition plan,in your milestones\\\\n3. Set up necessary access and permissions for the new team.\\\\n4. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions with the current Pagoda team.\\\\n5. Implement and test any necessary changes or improvements to the infrastructure.\\\\n6. Perform thorough testing to ensure data integrity and system performance.\\\\n7. Update all relevant documentation.\\\\n8. Gradually transition operational responsibilities.\\\\n9. Establish new support channels and processes.\\\\n10. Conduct a final review and handover with the Infrastructure Committee.\\\\n11. Conduct official communications on your channels and with the NEAR Developer ecosystems and relevant stakeholders\\\\n12. As part of this RFP and based on current usage, the goal is to provide this as a public good. Part of this transition strategy may include pushing users to alternatives like FastNEAR API. \\\\n13. Estimated transition time, not taking into account any KYC or KYB blockers, is 1 week.  \\\\n\\\\n### Service Level Agreements\\\\n\\\\n1. **Availability**\\\\n    * **Uptime Guarantee**: 99.0% monthly uptime\\\\n    * **Downtime Allowance**: Up to 0.1% of downtime per month\\\\n2. **Performance**:\\\\n    * *This should be tracked internally and shared with Infrastructure Committee (IC)*\\\\n    * **Response Time**:\\\\n        * Better or in line with existing response time.\\\\n    * **Rate Limiting**:\\\\n        * Please outline your rate limiting plan to continue to support Kit Wallet as a public good, if applicable. \\\\n3. **Support**\\\\n* **Support Availability**: Community-based support only (e.g., through forums, GitHub issues, or a developer community Slack/Telegram/Discord channel)\\\\n* **Response Time**: No guaranteed response time, but best-effort responses within 24-48 hours. A single point of contact for urgent issues.\\\\n4. **Data Integrity**\\\\n* **Data Consistency**: \\\\n    * Ensure that there is data validation in place (to show proper information). \\\\n    * Proper backup of data is maintained and the data is up to date. \\\\n5. **Updates and Changes**\\\\n* **Notice for Breaking Changes**: At least 7 days\\\\\\' notice for any breaking changes in the API or infrastructure\\\\n* **Versioning**: Ensure that the new API versions will be backward-compatible wherever possible.\\\\n* Maintenance - Proper updates to the community and stakeholders about any major maintenance which could impact the service, experience and uptime of the API adversely. \\\\n6. **Limitations**\\\\n    * **No SLA Credits**: No financial credits or compensation for outages or performance issues for free public good services. \\\\n    * **Fair Use Policy**: Provide Explicit statements about the intended use for development and the prohibition of production workloads\\\\n7. **Termination Rights**: The right to suspend or terminate the service for users who exceed fair use or misuse the service. IC must be informed about these.\\\\n8. **Failure to Perform:** If Kit Wallet maintenance falls below the performance aforementioned benchmarks, the Infrastructure Committee has the right to transition this public good to another vendor. The current maintainer will be required to facilitate the transition. \\\\n\\\\n### Budget Guidelines\\\\n\\\\n* **Budget**: Proposals should outline a **detailed budget**. A clear breakdown of costs, including development, testing, documentation, maintenance & support, infrastructure, 3rd party services and external API costs. Maintenance cost should be calculated accurately based on provided usage information and existing software costs. Being able to properly assess a budget based on usage is a major factor for qualifying legitimate vendors.\\\\n* **Milestones**: Please highlight the details of the various milestones that are included in your development plan and relevant budgets attached to each milestone. Any metrics around success of the milestone (acceptance criterion) should also be included. Milestone examples include upon signing of agreement, upon official transition, 6 month billing period, 12 month billing period, \\\\u{2026} and so forth. \\\\n* **Contingency**: Include a contingency plan for potential overruns or unexpected expenses. In the event that expense for providing free or a public good to the NEAR ecosystem, there should be a clear policy to report expenses incurred by NEAR usage to cover additional costs and prove that costs exceeded previous budgets. \\\\n\\\\n### Required Experience\\\\n\\\\n* **Experience:** Proven experience in big data processing, cloud infrastructure management, and blockchain data indexing, preferably within the blockchain or fintech sectors. Experience working with NEAR Protocol is a plus.\\\\n* **Portfolio:** Examples of previous work and case studies demonstrating success in similar projects.\\\\n* **Team:** A skilled team comprising developers, data engineers, and support staff with relevant experience.\\\\n* **Relevant Business:** Demonstrate that your team has an existing business that would motivate you to continue building and maintaining this infrastructure\\\\n\\\\n## Resources\\\\n\\\\n**Alternatives to Kit Wallet;**\\\\n\\\\n* Fast NEAR API Server: [https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs) (hosted free alternative)\\\\n* Pagoda enhanced api: [https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer](https://github.com/here-wallet/near-zmq-indexer) \\\\n\\\\n**Support;** \\\\n\\\\n* NEAR Indexer Working Group [https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data](https://nearbuilders.com/tg-data) \\\\n\\\\n**Kit Wallet Resources;**\\\\n\\\\n* [https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper](https://github.com/near/near-contract-helper)\\\\n* Indexer Endpoints API: (\\\\n \\\\n added\\\\n \\\\n as project coordinator\\\\n \\\\n ) : (\\\\n \\\\n changed project coordinator from{\\\\\\\" \\\\\\\"}\\\\n \\\\n to \\\\n \\\\n );\\\\n case \\\\\\\"timeline\\\\\\\": {\\\\n const modifiedKeys = Object.keys(modifiedValue);\\\\n const originalKeys = Object.keys(originalValue);\\\\n return modifiedKeys.map((i, index) => {\\\\n const text = parseTimelineKeyAndValue(i, originalValue, modifiedValue);\\\\n return (\\\\n text && (\\\\n \\\\n {text}\\\\n {text && \\\\\\\"\\\\u{ff65}\\\\\\\"}\\\\n \\\\n )\\\\n );\\\\n });\\\\n }\\\\n default:\\\\n return null;\\\\n }\\\\n};\\\\nconst LogIconContainer = styled.div`\\\\n margin-left: 50px;\\\\n z-index: 99;\\\\n @media screen and (max-width: 768px) {\\\\n margin-left: 10px;\\\\n }\\\\n`;\\\\nconst Log = ({ timestamp }) => {\\\\n const updatedData = useMemo(\\\\n () =>\\\\n state.changedKeysListWithValues.find((obj) =>\\\\n Object.values(obj).some(\\\\n (value) =>\\\\n value && parseFloat(value.modifiedValue / 1e6) === timestamp\\\\n )\\\\n ),\\\\n [state.changedKeysListWithValues, timestamp]\\\\n );\\\\n const editorId = updatedData.editorId;\\\\n const valuesArray = Object.values(updatedData ?? {});\\\\n // if valuesArray length is 2 that means it only has timestamp and editorId\\\\n if (!updatedData || valuesArray.length === 2) {\\\\n return <>;\\\\n }\\\\n return valuesArray.map((i, index) => {\\\\n if (i.key && i.key !== \\\\\\\"timestamp\\\\\\\") {\\\\n return (\\\\n \\\\n \\\\n 1\\\\n ? \\\\\\\"\\\\\\\"\\\\n : \\\\\\\"inline-flex\\\\\\\")\\\\n }\\\\n >\\\\n \\\\n {\\\\\\\" \\\\\\\"}\\\\n \\\\n {parseProposalKeyAndValue(i.key, i.modifiedValue, i.originalValue)}\\\\n {i.key !== \\\\\\\"timeline\\\\\\\" && \\\\\\\"\\\\u{ff65}\\\\\\\"}\\\\n \\\\n \\\\n \\\\n );\\\\n }\\\\n });\\\\n};\\\\nif (Array.isArray(state.data)) {\\\\n return (\\\\n \\\\n 2 ? \\\\\\\"110%\\\\\\\" : \\\\\\\"150%\\\\\\\" }}\\\\n >\\\\n
